snippet: G.O.P. efforts to rein in what it says are the excesses of the Obama administration played out in hearings, highlighting how election-year politics are overtaking business on Capitol Hill.
abstract: Efforts by congressional Republicans to rein in what they say are the excesses of the Obama administration play out in hearings, highlighting how election-year politics are overtaking business on Capitol Hill; hearings involve merits of lawsuit that Speaker John A Boehner plans to file against Pres Obama over his use of executive power in changing health care law, and Democratic campaign activities.
lead_paragraph: G.O.P. efforts to rein in what it says are the excesses of the Obama administration played out in hearings, highlighting how election-year politics are overtaking business on Capitol Hill.

headline.main: Partisanship Infuses Hearings on Health Law and Executive Power
headline.print_headline: Partisanship Infuses Hearings on Health Law and Executive Power
